verses.kjv: Then said he unto the disciples, It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe unto him, through whom they come!
verses.web: He said to the disciples, “It is impossible that no occasions of stumbling should come, but woe to him through whom they come!
verses.ct: Jesus said to his disciples, "It's inevitable that things will come along that cause people to sin, but how terrible it will be for the person who causes them!

verses.kjv: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.
verses.web: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.
verses.ct: It would be better for that person to have a millstone tied around their neck and be thrown into the sea than to cause one of these little ones to stumble.

verses.kjv: Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.
verses.web: Be careful. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.
verses.ct: So watch yourselves. If a fellow believer sins against you, confront them about it. And if they repent, forgive them.

verses.kjv: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.
verses.web: If he sins against you seven times in the day, and seven times returns, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.”
verses.ct: Even if they sin against you 7 times in a single day, and each time they come back and say, 'I repent,' you must forgive them."

verses.kjv: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.
verses.web: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”
verses.ct: The apostles said to the Lord, "Increase our faith."

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.
verses.web: The Lord said, “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, ‘Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.ct: The Lord replied, "If you had faith even as small as a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, 'Uproot yourself and plant yourself in the sea,' and it would obey you.

verses.kjv: But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?
verses.web: But who is there among you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say when he comes in from the field, ‘Come immediately and sit down at the table,’
verses.ct: Suppose one of you has a servant who's been out plowing or tending sheep. When he comes in from the field, would you say, 'Come sit down right away and eat'?

verses.kjv: And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?
verses.web: and will not rather tell him, ‘Prepare my supper, clothe yourself properly, and serve me, while I eat and drink. Afterward you shall eat and drink’?
verses.ct: Of course not. You'd say, 'Get my dinner ready, then put on your apron and serve me while I eat and drink. After that, you can eat and drink.'

verses.kjv: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.
verses.web: Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded? I think not.
verses.ct: Would you thank the servant for doing what he was told to do? I don't think so.

verses.kjv: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.
verses.web: Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, ‘We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.’ ”
verses.ct: It's the same with you. When you've done everything you were commanded to do, say, 'We are unworthy servants. We've simply done our duty.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.
verses.web: As he was on his way to Jerusalem, he was passing along the borders of Samaria and Galilee.
verses.ct: As Jesus was making his way to Jerusalem, he traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.

verses.kjv: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:
verses.web: As he entered into a certain village, ten men who were lepers met him, who stood at a distance.
verses.ct: When he entered a certain village, 10 men with leprosy met him. They kept their distance,

verses.kjv: And they lifted up their voices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.
verses.web: They lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
verses.ct: but they called out loudly, "Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!"

verses.kjv: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go shew yourselves unto the priests. And it came to pass, that, as they went, they were cleansed.
verses.web: When he saw them, he said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” As they went, they were cleansed.
verses.ct: When he saw them, he said, "Go show yourselves to the priests." And as they were on their way, they were healed.

verses.kjv: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,
verses.web: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice.
verses.ct: One of them, when he realized he'd been healed, came running back, praising God at the top of his voice.

verses.kjv: And fell down on his face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.
verses.web: He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, giving him thanks; and he was a Samaritan.
verses.ct: He threw himself facedown at Jesus' feet, thanking him over and over. And this man was a Samaritan.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine?
verses.web: Jesus answered, “Weren’t the ten cleansed? But where are the nine?
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "Weren't all 10 healed? Where are the other 9?

verses.kjv: There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.
verses.web: Were there none found who returned to give glory to God, except this foreigner?”
verses.ct: Was no one willing to come back and give glory to God except this foreigner?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.
verses.web: Then he said to him, “Get up, and go your way. Your faith has healed you.”
verses.ct: Then he told the man, "Stand up and go on your way. Your faith has healed you."

verses.kjv: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
verses.web: Being asked by the Pharisees when God’s Kingdom would come, he answered them, “God’s Kingdom doesn’t come with observation;
verses.ct: Some Pharisees asked Jesus when the kingdom of God would come. He answered, "The kingdom of God doesn't arrive with visible signs you can point to.

verses.kjv: Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
verses.web: neither will they say, ‘Look, here!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ for behold, God’s Kingdom is within you.”
verses.ct: No one will say, 'Look, it's here!' or 'It's over there!' because the kingdom of God is already among you."

verses.kjv: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.
verses.web: He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
verses.ct: Then he said to his disciples, "The time is coming when you'll long to see even one of the days of the Son of Man, but you won't see it.

verses.kjv: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not after them, nor follow them.
verses.web: They will tell you, ‘Look, here!’ or ‘Look, there!’ Don’t go away or follow after them,
verses.ct: People will tell you, 'Look, he's here!' or 'He's over there!' Don't chase after them or follow them.

verses.kjv: For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day.
verses.web: for as the lightning, when it flashes out of one part under the sky, shines to another part under the sky; so will the Son of Man be in his day.
verses.ct: Because just as lightning flashes and lights up the entire sky from one horizon to the other, that's how it will be when the Son of Man comes.

verses.kjv: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.
verses.web: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
verses.ct: But first he must suffer terribly and be rejected by this generation.

verses.kjv: And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.
verses.web: As it was in the days of Noah, even so will it be also in the days of the Son of Man.
verses.ct: When the Son of Man returns, it will be just like it was in the days of Noah.

verses.kjv: They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.
verses.web: They ate, they drank, they married, and they were given in marriage until the day that Noah entered into the ship, and the flood came and destroyed them all.
verses.ct: People were eating, drinking, and getting married right up until the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.

verses.kjv: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;
verses.web: Likewise, even as it was in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;
verses.ct: It will be the same as it was in the days of Lot. People were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, and building—

verses.kjv: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.
verses.web: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky and destroyed them all.
verses.ct: but on the very day Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.

verses.kjv: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.
verses.web: It will be the same way in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.
verses.ct: That's exactly how it will be on the day the Son of Man is revealed.

verses.kjv: In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back.
verses.web: In that day, he who will be on the housetop and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away. Let him who is in the field likewise not turn back.
verses.ct: On that day, if you're on the rooftop, don't go back inside to grab your belongings. If you're out in the field, don't turn back for anything.

verses.kjv: Remember Lot’s wife.
verses.web: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.ct: Remember Lot's wife!

verses.kjv: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.
verses.web: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.
verses.ct: Whoever tries to hold on to their life will lose it, but whoever lets go of their life will preserve it.

verses.kjv: I tell you, in that night there shall be two men in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
verses.web: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed. One will be taken and the other will be left.
verses.ct: I tell you, on that night 2 people will be in one bed—one will be taken and the other left behind.

verses.kjv: Two women shall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
verses.web: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken and the other will be left.”
verses.ct: 2 women will be grinding grain together—one will be taken and the other left behind.

verses.kjv: Two men shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
verses.ct: 2 men will be working in a field—one will be taken and the other left behind."

verses.kjv: And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body is, thither will the eagles be gathered together.
verses.web: They, answering, asked him, “Where, Lord?” He said to them, “Where the body is, there the vultures will also be gathered together.”
verses.ct: The disciples asked him, "Where will this happen, Lord?" He answered, "Where there's a dead body, the vultures will gather."
